intro: Silene antirrhina var. depauperata, commonly known as the slender campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. The plant features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. It is characterized by its reduced floral structure compared to other species in the genus. Silene antirrhina var. depauperata is adapted to harsh climates and is often found in mountainous regions across Europe and Asia.
